contentList.content:
Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Constitution">Constitution</LSTag> by 1, to a maximum of 20. Once per turn, when you hit a creature that deals bludgeoning damage, you move it 2m away from you, provided the target is no more than one size larger than you.
Also, when you score a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> with a melee attack that deals bludgeoning damage to a creature, <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against that creature are made with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> until the start of your next turn.

Studying occult lore, you have unlocked eldritch power within yourself: you learn one Eldritch Invocation option of your choice from the Warlock class.If you already have an Invocation, the one you choose must be different.

Your exposure to the Feywild's magic has changed you, increasing your <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityScore">Ability Score</LSTag> score by 1.
You also learn the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MistyStep_FeyTouched">Misty Step</LSTag> spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the Divination or Enchantment school of magic. Your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbilityModifier">Spellcasting Modifier</LSTag> is the ability increased by this feat.

Prerequisite: Proficiency with a martial weapon
You learn one Fighting Style option of your choice from the Fighter class. If you already have a style, the one you choose must be different.
You’ve manifested some of the power of chromatic dragons, granting you the following benefits:

As an action, you can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Healer_Heal">Heal</LSTag> another creature. That creature can't regain hit points in this way again until they finish a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>.
You can spend 10 minutes <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_InspiringLeader">Inspiring</LSTag> your companions, shoring up their resolve to fight.

Prerequisite: Spellcasting or Pact Magic feature
You learn two Metamagic options of your choice from the sorcerer class. You can use only one Metamagic option on a spell when you cast it, unless the option says otherwise. You also gain 2 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag> to spend on Metamagic. You regain all spent sorcery points when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

Your exposure to the Shadowfell's magic has changed you, increasing your chosen <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityScore">Ability Score</LSTag> by 1.
You also learn the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Invisibility">Invisibility</LSTag> spell and one 1st-level spell of your choice. The 1st-level spell must be from the Illusion or Necromancy school of magic. Your <LSTag Tooltip="SpellcastingAbilityModifier">Spellcasting Modifier</LSTag> is the ability increased by this feat.

Increase one <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityScore">Ability Score</LSTag> by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You gain one <LSTag Tooltip="Proficiency">Proficiency</LSTag> in one skill of your choice, and gain <LSTag Tooltip="Expertise">Expertise</LSTag> in one skill of your choice.

Increase your <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> or <LSTag Tooltip="Dexterity">Dexterity</LSTag> by 1, to a maximum of 20. Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee attack that deals slashing damage, you reduce the target's <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">speed</LSTag> by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.
Also, when you score a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> with a melee attack that deals slashing damage to a creature, the target has <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">disadvantage</LsTag> on all attack rolls.

You learn to move things with your mind. Increase the <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityScore">Ability Score</LSTag> score by 1, to a maximum of 20.
You can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MageHand_Telekinetic">Mage Hand</LSTag> without verbal or somantic components. You can also <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Shove_Telekinetic_Push">Push</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Shove_Telekinetic_Pull">Pull</LSTag> a creature telekinetically, using the chosen ability score as the <LSTag Tooltip="DifficultyClass">spell DC</LSTag>.

As a <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="BonusActionPoint">bonus action</LSTag>, you can touch a simple or martial weapon and infuse it with one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra 1d4 damage of the chosen type when it hits.
After you use this bonus action, you can’t do so again until you finish a long rest.
Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee attack that deals bludgeoning damage, you move it away from you, provided the target is no more than one size larger than you.

When you score a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> with a melee attack that deals bludgeoning damage to a creature, <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against that creature are made with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> until the start of your next turn.
Your exposure to the Feywild's magic has changed you, increasing your <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> score by 1.
Your exposure to the Feywild's magic has changed you, increasing your <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> score by 1.
Your exposure to the Feywild's magic has changed you, increasing your <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> score by 1.

As an action, you can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Healer_Heal">Heal</LSTag> another creature. That creature can't regain hit points in this way again until they finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

Unlocks the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_InspiringLeader">Inspiring</LSTag> spell, which gives all friendly creatures (including yourself) within 9m of you 5 <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag>.

You gain 2 <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="SorceryPoint">Sorcery Points</LSTag> to spend on Metamagic. You regain all spent sorcery points when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

When you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage, you can use your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">reaction</LSTag> to give yourself <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to that instance of damage. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
Your exposure to the Shadowfell's magic has changed you, increasing your <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> score by 1.
Your exposure to the Shadowfell's magic has changed you, increasing your <LSTag Tooltip="Intelligence">Intelligence</LSTag> score by 1.
Your exposure to the Shadowfell's magic has changed you, increasing your <LSTag Tooltip="Wisdom">Wisdom</LSTag> score by 1 .

Once per turn, when you hit a creature with a melee attack that deals slashing damage, you reduce the <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">speed</LSTag> of the target by 3m until the start of your next turn.

When you score a <LSTag Tooltip="CriticalHit">Critical Hit</LSTag> with a melee attack that deals slashing damage to a creature, you grievously wound it. Until the start of your next turn, the target has <LSTag Tooltip="Disadvantage">Disadvantage</LSTag> on all attack rolls.

Increase the chosen <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityScore">Ability Score</LSTag> by 1. You can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MageHand_Telekinetic">Mage Hand</LSTag> without verbal or somantic components. You can also <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Shove_Telekinetic_Push">Push</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Shove_Telekinetic_Pull">Pull</LSTag> a creature telekinetically, using the chosen ability score as the spell DC.

Increase the chosen <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityScore">Ability Score</LSTag> by 1. You can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MageHand_Telekinetic">Mage Hand</LSTag> without verbal or somantic components. You can also <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Shove_Telekinetic_Push">Push</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Shove_Telekinetic_Pull">Pull</LSTag> a creature telekinetically, using the chosen ability score as the spell DC.

Increase the chosen <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityScore">Ability Score</LSTag> by 1. You can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MageHand_Telekinetic">Mage Hand</LSTag> without verbal or somantic components. You can also <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Shove_Telekinetic_Push">Push</LSTag> and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Shove_Telekinetic_Pull">Pull</LSTag> a creature telekinetically, using the chosen ability score as the spell DC.

When you take acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison damage, you can use your <LSTag Type="ActionResource" Tooltip="ReactionActionPoint">reaction</LSTag> to give yourself <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to that instance of damage. You can use this reaction a number of times equal to your <LSTag Tooltip="ProficiencyBonus">Proficiency Bonus</LSTag>, and you regain all expended uses when you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.

All creatures (including yourself) within [1] of you gain <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">Temporary Hit Points</LSTag> equal to your current level plus your <LSTag Tooltip="Charisma">Charisma</LSTag> <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>. You cannot inspire again until after a short or <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>

You can touch a simple or martial weapon and infuse it with one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or poison. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra [1] of the chosen type when it hits.
You can touch a simple or martial weapon and infuse it with acid. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra [1] when it hits.
You can touch a simple or martial weapon and infuse it with cold. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra [1] when it hits.
You can touch a simple or martial weapon and infuse it with fire. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra [1] when it hits.
You can touch a simple or martial weapon and infuse it with lightning. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra [1] when it hits.
You can touch a simple or martial weapon and infuse it with poison. For the next minute, the weapon deals an extra [1] when it hits.
You can tend to a creature's wounds. You restore [1] to it. That creature can't regain hit points in this way again until they finish a <LSTag Tooltip="ShortRest">Short Rest</LSTag>.
You learn the <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_MageHand_Telekinetic">Mage Hand</LSTag> cantrip. You can cast it without verbal or somatic components.
You try to telekinetically shove one creature you can see within [1] of you. They must succeed on a Strength <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or be pushed [2] away from you.
You try to telekinetically shove one creature you can see within [1] of you. They must succeed on a Strength <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throw</LSTag> or be pulled [2] toward you.
For the next minute, this weapon deals an extra [1] when it hits.
For the next minute, this weapon deals an extra [1] damage when it hits.
For the next minute, this weapon deals an extra [1] damage when it hits.
For the next minute, this weapon deals an extra [1] damage when it hits.
For the next minute, this weapon deals an extra [1] damage when it hits.
<LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> against this creature are made with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> until the start of your next turn
This creature can't regain hit points via the Healer feat again until they finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>.
Each creature gains 5 <LSTag Tooltip="TemporaryHitPoints">temporary hit points</LSTag>.
Resistant to Acid for one instance of damage.
Resistant to Cold for one instance of damage.
Resistant to Fire for one instance of damage.
Resistant to Lightning for one instance of damage.
Resistant to Poison for one instance of damage.
Can't use again until you finish a <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag>

Once per turn, when you hit a creature with an attack that deals bludgeoning damage, you can move it 5 feet to an unoccupied space, provided the target is no more than one size larger than you |Large size or smaller|.
